category.Name: Fraud Orders
category.Description: Fraudent orders.

category.Name: DDoS Attack
category.Description: Participating in distributed denial-of-service (usually part of botnet).

category.Name: FTP Brute-Force
category.Description: None

category.Name: Ping of Death
category.Description: Oversized IP packet.

category.Name: Phishing
category.Description: Phishing websites and/or email.

category.Name: Fraud VoIP
category.Description: None

category.Name: Open Proxy
category.Description: Open proxy, open relay, or Tor exit node.

category.Name: Web Spam
category.Description: Comment/forum spam, HTTP referer spam, or other CMS spam.

category.Name: Email Spam
category.Description: Spam email content, infected attachments, phishing emails, and spoofed senders (typically via exploited host or SMTP server abuse). Note: Limit comments to only relevent information (instead of log dumps) and be sure to remove PII if you want to remain anonymous.

category.Name: Blog Spam
category.Description: CMS blog comment spam.

category.Name: VPN IP
category.Description: Conjunctive category.

category.Name: Port Scan
category.Description: Scanning for open ports and vulnerable services.

category.Name: Hacking
category.Description: None

category.Name: SQL Injection
category.Description: Attempts at SQL injection.

category.Name: Spoofing
category.Description: None

category.Name: Brute-Force
category.Description: Credential brute-force attacks on webpage logins and services like SSH, FTP, SIP, SMTP, RDP, etc. This category is seperate from DDoS attacks.

category.Name: Bad Web Bot
category.Description: Webpage scraping (for email addresses, content, etc) and crawlers that do not honor robots.txt. Excessive requests and user agent spoofing can also be reported here.

category.Name: Exploited Host
category.Description: Host is likely infected with malware and being used for other attacks or to host malicious content. The host owner may not be aware of the compromise. This category is often used in combination with other attack categories.

category.Name: Web App Attack
category.Description: Attempts to probe for or exploit installed web applications such as a CMS like WordPress/Drupal, e-commerce solutions, forum software, phpMyAdmin and various other software plugins/solutions.

category.Name: SSH
category.Description: Secure Shell (SSH) abuse. Use this category in combination with more specific categories.

category.Name: IoT Targeted
category.Description: Abuse was targeted at an "Internet of Things" type device. Include information about what type of device was targeted in the comments.
